snippet: In a defeat for California's political parties, a Federal judge today upheld the open primary election system adopted when the state's voters supported a proposition on the ballot last year.    ''Proposition 198 is a nondiscriminatory measure that...
lead_paragraph: In a defeat for California's political parties, a Federal judge today upheld the open primary election system adopted when the state's voters supported a proposition on the ballot last year. ''Proposition 198 is a nondiscriminatory measure that was adopted by a clear majority of voters, with a convincing margin from both major parties, and which advances interests that are uniquely those of the state and its electorate as opposed to the parties,'' Judge David Levi of Federal District Court here wrote in his ruling.
abstract: Federal Judge David Levi, in defeat for California's political parties, upholds open primary election system adopted when state's voters supported proposition on ballot in 1996 (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; California Judge Backs Open Primary Election
